page.title: 15Commuter Areas
page.content: The only industry found is a{small {established iron foundry works}below St.Ippolyts church.Numerous lanes and footpaths cover the area. This idyllic rural scene is deceptive in some respects.The area is also a {classic example of commuter-land and {London weekend countryside.}It is virtually{green belt or "green heart" land with the end of the Dunstable- Luton conurbation close by to the West,the Hitchin-Letchworth-Baldock conurbation to the East and the Stevenage and Hatfield urban sprawl to the South-East.Hence{dense population {concentrations virtually surround the {area.}Heavy traffic moves on the M1 to the West, the A1(M) to the East and just to the North, the A505 connects them both.Overhead busy air traffic makes for Luton airport.
